results.title: Destruction Derby
results.brief_description: In this animated fable with no narration, a caveman builds a car and soon the whole planet is overrun with cars, trucks and airplanes and the air choked with polluting fumes. The imaginative cartoon focuses on one aspect of destruction to the environment and offers a tongue-in-cheek solution - send all cars off in a rocket, into outer space.

results.title: Despotism
results.brief_description: This is the companion piece to the film, “Democracy”. It presents the abstract thesis that power concentrated in the hands of a few, who thus control the means of communication and are able to slant economic distribution in their own favour, and restricted respect of one’s fellow men, are two of the important characteristics of despotism.

results.title: Desperate voyage
results.creator_credit: Christine Fox and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
Documents Operation “Sea Sweep” (Singapore, July 1979) attempting to give aid and assistance to the ‘boat people’, helping them safely to land, supplying petrol and medical aid. Operation “Sea Sweep” battle politics to keep the ship registered and operating.

results.title: A Desperate case
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A cautionary tale of a typical holiday suitcase. Crammed beyond its capacity, imperfectly fastened, inadequately and confusedly labelled, the railways transport it from station to station, seeking its true abode. Finally, one of its owners comes to the nightmare tribunal where those who maltreat their luggage are dealt with. Did it happen? Was it a dream? Be warned. See this film. Avoid making yours a desperate case.

results.title: Designing with everyday materials: corrugated paper
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Jack Stoops Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the construction of imaginative and varied art projects from corrugated paper. Shows the materials and tools required, the techniques of cutting and joining, and the design possibilities in working with this material.

results.title: Designing for the disabled
results.brief_description: Some of the problems of wheelchair manoeuvrability are described and the feelings of loneliness, idiosyncrasy and social isolation that many disabled drivers have. Analyses the “real-world problem situation” and identifies problem elements.

results.title: Designed for living
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Presents Canada’s accomplishments in industrial design, and the National Industrial Design Council’s encouragement of good design for contemporary living by illustrating a wide selection of household articles. The film defines good design, providing a yardstick for the consumer to use in assessing the merits of manufactured goods, ranging from kitchen utensils to living room furniture. Written by Lois Edwards; photography by John Spotton; editing by Dennis Sawyer; music by Eldon Rathburn; Voice and Narration by Maude Ferguson.

results.title: Design with paper
results.brief_description: Basic instruction designed to stimulate creative experimentation and to explore fundamental principles with simple, basic folds using paper. These designs advance to more complex three dimensional forms which are made possible buy measuring, scoring, folding and pasting.

results.title: Design of American public education
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and United Productions of America
results.brief_description: Describes the organisational structure of a centrally controlled public education system and the decentralised system under state supervision. Points out that a basic objective of American public education is the advancement of an individualised system intended to produce students capable of assuming an adult role in society.
